intro: Eriogonum chrysocephalum, commonly known as goldenhead buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats like grasslands and rocky slopes. Eriogonum chrysocephalum is an important species for local ecosystems and is sometimes used in native plant gardens.
